question: I was diagnosed with Diabetic Amyotrophy about 1 yesr ago with symptoms of severe thigh pain,numb front of one thigh (from groin to knee), shooting pain with twitching,off balance, couldn't quite locate the ground sensorily, severe weakness in thigh and 40 pound weight loss.  I went through a period of a few weeks where I couldn't stand completely straight at the hips so my hips swiveled to walk (upper front thigh, groin muscles wouldn't stretch all the way to a straight position, though it felt I had).I went on seizure meds which slightly reduced pain and off balance.  I acquired a new pain in the lower back that was not structural.I was diagnosed soon after with hyperthyroid(Graves Desease) and gain back much strength and weight with thyroid meds.Now I am a year into this and no longer on seizure meds (took myself off) and feeling a new feeling of muscles in groin, butt and front and back thighs hurt like I exercised way to much (I did not)  Could something else beside this be going on with related symptomology.  Seems as soon as you say diabetes, that is the cause for everything.  What do I do now?  My sugar is under control and I have only had diabetes diagnosed for 6 years.  I am on symlin and so blood glycose levels are balanced.  Why am I not getting better?Thanks
title: Diabetic Amyotrophy
